resources.string: Cairo has so many hotels \n click and see more!
Cairo has so many parks \n click and see more!
Cairo has so many restaurants click and see more!
Cairo has so many historical places click and see more!
Situated inside the Kempinski Nile Hotel, Osmanly offers guests the chance to dine like a Sultan in this beautiful setting.
Osmanly, Kempinski Nile Hotel, Ahmed Ragheb Street 12, Cairo, Egypt
Tabla Luna, 41 Road 218, Digla, Maadi, Cairo, Egypt
For authentic Latin American food in a country very new to this cuisine, go to the much-loved restaurant Tabla Luna.
Birdcage, InterContinental Hotel, Corniche El Nil, Cairo, Egypt
Said to be the best Thai restaurant in Egypt, the Birdcage is located inside the Cairo Semiramis InterContinental Hotel.
Fasahet Somaya, Corner of Mohammed Mahmoud and Youssef El-Gendy, Cairo, Egypt
Fasahet Somaya has been making waves among the Cairo crowd, drawing in visitors with its loyal version of true Egyptian home cooking.
Zooba, 26th of July Street, Zamalek, Cairo, Egypt
This casual, hole-in-the-wall style restaurant is the perfect spot for a quick lunch or casual dinner.
Andrea El Mariouteya, 59\-60 Mariouteya Canal Road, Cairo, Egypt
Andrea El Mariouteya is famous for its barbecued marinated chicken. The restaurant uses a special secret herb blend seemingly impossible to recreate at home.
Sequoia, 53 Abou El Feda Street, Zamalek, Cairo, Egypt
With floor-to-ceiling windows offering views out over the water and the rest of the city, Sequoia attracts visitors wishing to enjoy a meal in a laid-back atmosphere.
Little Swiss Restaurant, Street 18 Villa 17 (Corner Street 84), Maadi Sarayat, Cairo, Egypt
Run by a lovely Swiss lady, the Little Swiss Restaurant is the best place in Cairo for beautiful raclettes and scrumptious fondues.
Salah Salem St, El-Darb El-Ahmar, Cairo Governorate
Manicured gardens and lawns with fountains, cafes, restaurants and an open-air theater, plus city views.
Salah Salem, Ad Deyorah, Misr Al Qadimah, Cairo Governorate
El Gabalaya St, Al Gabalayah, Zamalek, Giza Governorate
This is a very suitable park for family outings. It is the second largest park after Al-Azhar Park, which is designed in the country style.
Founded in the late 19th century, this is oldest park in this list. It is very beautiful destination that is considered as one of the largest botanical gardens in the world.
Tower inspired by lotus flowers, made up of 8 million mosaic lozenges, with a revolving restaurant.
Salah El Din Al Ayouby Citadel
Al Abageyah, Qesm Al Khalifah، Cairo Governorate
Imposing fortress and wall built by Saladin in the 12th century as protection against the Crusaders.
Kom Ghorab, Misr Al Qadimah, Cairo Governorate
Coptic Christian church with a wooden roof in the shape of Noah\'s ark, a 5th-century pulpit and icons.
In the Gezira Exhibition Grounds, Opposite the Opera House, Cairo and Nile Delta 11511
15 Meret Basha, Ismailia, Qasr an Nile, Cairo Governorate
Extensive collection of Egyptian artifacts covering 5,000 years, including Tutankhamun\'s treasures.
Large souk in the bazaar district selling souvenirs and crafts plus jewelry, clothing and spices.
The Egyptian military\'s official history museum offering exhibits on the pharaohs to modern day.
Huge Islamic art museum with over 100,000 exhibits spanning history in a grand restored building.
Ad Doqi, Giza, Oula, Giza, Giza Governorate 12411
the Pyramids are the world’s oldest tourist attraction as they are the only survivors of the Seven Ancient Wonders of the World.
Darb Al Sayegh, El-Darb El-Ahmar, Cairo Governorate, Egypt

This grand structure finished in 972 by Gohar was the first mosque to be built in Cairo and is the most significant building from the Fatmid period.It claims to be one of the world\’s oldest surviving universities.
Charles De Gaulle, Oula, Giza, Giza Governorate 12612, Egypt
Zoo specializing in African wildlife, with grottoes, a bridge by Eiffel and natural history museum.
3 El Thawra Council St Zamalek, Cairo
Located on the banks of the Nile River at the southern tip of quiet El Gezirah island, this 27-story Cairo luxury hotel is within easy reach of the Opera House
Located in Al Duqqi, this luxury hotel is within 2 mi (3 km) of Cairo University, Cairo Tower, and Egyptian Museum.
Four Seasons Hotel Cairo at Nile Plaza
This family-friendly hotel is located in the city center, within 1 mi (2 km) of American University of Cairo and Egyptian Museum.
Corniche El Nil, Garden City, Cairo
This family-friendly hotel is located in the city center, within 1 mi (2 km) of American University of Cairo, Tahrir Square, and League of Arab States.
This family-friendly Cairo hotel is located in Downtown Cairo, within 1 mi (2 km) of Tahrir Square, Egyptian Museum, Cairo Tower and Museum
Omar Ibn El Khattab Street, Cairo
This family-friendly Cairo hotel is located near the airport, within 3 mi (5 km) of City Stars, Cairo International Stadium and Cairo International Convention
This family-friendly Cairo hotel is located on the boardwalk, within 1 mi (2 km) of American University of Cairo and Egyptian Museum.
